titlestmt.titleproper: Edwin S. Dunkerley genealogical research materials and family papers 1954-1982
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Edwin S. Dunkerley genealogical research materials and family papers
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Edwin Squire Dunkerley (1902-1982) was a graduate of Germantown High School and took business courses at Temple University. He served in the Marine Corps from 1943-1946 and 1950-1963. He was a member of the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania, the Falls Baptist Church, and Union Lodge #121, F&AM.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of records and genealogical research materials related to the Dunkerley, Schofield and related families. Materials include: Dunkerley's discharge papers from the Marines from 1954; notes and extracts from primary and published sources, other notes, and family charts; an address given by Dunkerley on Cemetery Records in Philadelphia, 1974 and notes on cemetery records; miscellaneous newspaper notices; and the Simpson family record from a Bible and photocopies of the record.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
